title: Cryptocurrency Exchange
description: Most African countries have no cryptocurrency exchange that supports trading in their native currency.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer has submitted the same proposal 5 times (3 times in the developer ecosystem, once in grow Africa and once in NFT business models). It is not clear how a cryptocurrency exchange is related to the developer ecosystem. The description of why this would be useful focusses on users not having access to local currency pairs.
f6_assessments.q1:
No real plan has been presented and a statement that "We have developed and tested industry-grade cryptocurrency exchanges" doesn't mean much without evidence. Each of the 5 proposals submitted has some small change in this experience. If they had done them all, why not add all of them to every proposal?

I would expect if an existing exchange wanted to add some more currency pairs they would just do so, why build a new exchange?
What countries/currency pairs do you expect to add? 

How are you going to market the project? 100,000 demo users in 3 months? Why do you think you can achieve this?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has given deliverables, timelines and numbers of users and in that sense progress would be easy to audit. Though the numbers  seem to be too high to be achievable (100,000 demo users in 3 months with no marketing plan?).
f6_assessments.reply: Each proposal addresses independent problems and solutions. The proposal effectively addresses the ability of African nations to onboard into the Cardano ecosystem with their fiat currencies. The project URL was provided with a test username and password. There are more than 300 million cryptocurrency users and traders worldwide. 100,000 demo users can be achieved in a few days only in Ethiopia. This number can be even bigger in the entire continent. This is going to be the first African-based cryptocurrency exchange that supports the native currency of all African countries. Project URL: https://pilot.ennarea.com/ UserName: user1@ennarea.com, Password: #GoAfrica1888!.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal effectively address the ability of African nations to onboard into the Cardano ecosystem with their fiat currencies. Ennarea will serve as a cryptocurrency trading platform by enabling users to sell and buy digital assets with their native currency.
f6_assessments.q1: There should be more transparency into this team, and although they have a pilot program for this proposal, there is no roadmap or significant milestones that will lead to a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: Given the large budget, this proposal can spend it's way to success, but the key performance indicators (KPIs) are ambitious with 2,000,000 users on the platform within 12 months. The ability to audit this proposal needs clearer metrics that can be easily viewed to determine if the proposal is successful.

f6_assessments.q0: Crypto exchange which supports African Fiat currency is a value addition for the adoption of Cardano in Africa. But this may not improve the developer ecosystem and its not in the sprit of the fund head.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer claims to have developed and tested industry-grade cryptocurrency exchanges. The proposal also references a demo site that shows the User Interface only. Any reference to the team size, qualification, and past experience of team members would have enabled a better evaluation of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The breakdown of the budget is sketchy. The breakdown of cost allots 100K for 2 devs. 2 devs may not be sufficient for running a DEX. The status of regulatory clearance for handling fiat in so many different currencies and lack of details on the other team member makes it difficult to assess the the proposal.
f6_assessments.reply: The proposal effectively addresses the ability of African nations to onboard into the Cardano ecosystem with their fiat currencies. Team experience is presented with a working product.

f6_assessments.q0:
The stated proposal has a clear goal which is to enable users to sell and buy digital assets with their native fiat currency, including multiple African countries. 
It would perfectly fit in a category about DAPPs and how to grow the real world adoption of Cardano (especially in Africa). However it is not clear how this should help developers in their workflow and bring positive experiences to developers. How are developers incentivized? In my eyes a project with this amount of funding requirement should be fitting the purpose better
f6_assessments.q1: A prototype website is shown, which allows some simple tests, however it is not clear how long development will take, as by now only the frontend is functioning and the time plan till February 2022 is questionable.
f6_assessments.q2: It is not stated which metrics will be used to audit the success in enhancing the developer ecosystem.
f6_assessments.reply: The platform is already developed and ready for production, it has all the functionality a cryptocurrency exchange has. Project URL: https://pilot.ennarea.com/ UserName: user1@ennarea.com , Password: #GoAfrica1888!. Also, you can create a new user account.

f6_assessments.q0: This project is about developing a blockchain crypto exchange. The proposed project addresses a problem outside of this Challenge. In addition, the plan presented is incomplete, unspecific, and a number of questions remain unanswered (see other criterion). The proposer has posted 5 similar projects, all of which have the similar deficiencies, so some of the ratings are repetitive.
f6_assessments.q1: The team does not provide references. In addition, the proof-of-life is missing. The linked platform and demo account could objectively be from someone else, as there is no information about it. Furthermore, there is no connection between Cardano and the proposal. This project does not provide any information to evaluate the feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap without a detailed description of activities is useless. Metrics like users without context, wherever they come from. This proposal needs the mentioned details to get a better evaluation.This proposal is a completely non-transparent proposal, which does not contain any proof-of-life and documentation possibilities and therefore auditabilty is not possible.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal seems to be posted in the wrong place. Building a Cryptocurrency exchange does not bring more value to the Cardano ecosystem at this present moment.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has a good plan for an exchange however there is no information available about the team and its founders. There is not enough detailed information to assess whether the implementation of this plan can be successful.
f6_assessments.q2: I would expect an appropriate level of depth when addressing how this budget is going to be spent, especially considering it is asking for 200000. I am unable to establish the validity of claims made in this proposal. Finally, the proposal itself reads very poorly. It reads like a concept more than an executable proposal. It needs more editing so that it can be assessed properly given its direction. Perhaps reworking it and submitting it at the later stages will work
f6_assessments.reply: A cryptocurrency and digital asset exchange will highly impact the adoption of the Cardano blockchain in so many aspects. stable coins and central bank-issued digital currencies can be issued on the Cardno blockchain if an African-based cryptocurrency exchange is availbel. More defi and Dapps can be developed if they can easily be listed on an exchange.

f6_assessments.q0:
Assuming that the proposers' claim is true, that there is no cryptocurrency exchange for African fiat currencies, I would say that the end goal of the project is important. It does not, however, appear to be posted under the correct challenge, as it is not about developer tools.

The proposers should, moreover, be more careful to distinguish this proposal from their other proposal 'Cross-border payment processing', which uses the same mockup site, but for a project that in that case does not directly claim to be an exchange.
f6_assessments.q1:
Technical implementation of an exchange will probably be succesfull: the proposers appear to be simply buying the software, which begs the question: why do they mainly budget for paying salaries of two senior developers?

The proposers should describe how will they interact with the fiat world and attract users? What kind of partnerships will they form for processing cash or mobile payments popular in Africa? The specific user numbers indicated in the milestones, while could be realistic for Africa, do not seem realistic for the project as it lacks a marketing budget and planned partnerships for people to actually deposit fiat.   Plans on how to achieve this should be expanded upon.
f6_assessments.q2: The success timeline contains enough information on milestones, however, they do not seem realistic as discussed in the previous part. The budget is clearly explained.
f6_assessments.reply: The project has been already developed and deployed to the cloud, that doesn't mean development is finalized. Applications are developed and deployed continuously. To successfully operate a cryptocurrency exchange a number of talented developers are needed.

solution: Ennarea will serve as a cryptocurrency trading platform by enabling users to sell and buy digital assets with their native fiat currency.
experience: We have developed and tested industry-grade cryptocurrency exchanges.
